meanings.definition: A type of collective farm in the former Soviet Union.
meanings.sent1: The kolkozes in the village worked together to grow crops.
meanings.sent2: During the Soviet era, many farmers were part of a kolkozes.
meanings.sent3: The kolkozes decided to organize a group picnic on the farm.
meanings.sent4: The kolkozes were like a big family, sharing the work and the harvest.
meanings.sent5: The kolkozes symbolized unity and cooperation among farmers.

meanings.definition: The system of collective farming in the former Soviet Union.
meanings.sent1: People relied on the kolkozes for food production in the country.
meanings.sent2: The government implemented kolkozes to manage agricultural resources.
meanings.sent3: The kolkozes held a competition to see who could harvest the most potatoes.
meanings.sent4: The idea of kolkozes revolutionized farming practices in the region.
meanings.sent5: Joining the kolkozes meant contributing to the greater good of society.
